DifferentialConductivity

class pyrit.material.DifferentialConductivity(value, name: str = '')

Bases: MatProperty

Class that represents the differential conductivity \(\boldsymbol{\frac{\mathrm{d} J}{\mathrm{d} E}}\).

In case of a field-dependent conductivity \(\sigma(\boldsymbol{E})\), it is defined as

\[\boldsymbol{\frac{\mathrm{d} J}{\mathrm{d} E}} = \sigma(\boldsymbol{E}) \cdot \mathrm{unit\_tensor} + 2 \cdot \frac{\mathrm{d} \sigma}{\mathrm{d} E^2}(\boldsymbol{E}) \cdot \boldsymbol{E}\boldsymbol{E}^{\mathrm{T}}.\]

The definition is supported by pyrit.toolbox.MaterialLibrary.get_differential_tensor(), an example is given in tutorials/nonlinear_resistor.py.

Constructor of DifferentialConductivity

Parameters

  • value – Value of the differential conductivity (see source.material.MatProperty).

  • name (str, optional) – Name of the differential conductivity. The default is ‘’.

Return type

None.

Methods

compute_args

Compute the lists of arguments for a given value.

import_from_table

Reads the data of a material property.

update

Updates the arguments of the value, if possible.

Attributes

name

inverse_value

The inverse value

is_constant

Returns True if the value is constant, i.e. linear, homogeneous and not time dependent.

is_homogeneous

Returns True if the value is homogeneous and False if not

is_hysteretic

Returns True if the MatProperty is hysteretic and False if not

is_isotrop

Returns True if the MatProperty is isotrop and False if not

is_linear

Returns True if the value is linear and False if not

is_time_dependent

Returns True if the value is time dependent and False if not
